subject: Implement StoryCard component with expand/collapse
description:
## Goal
Create `StoryCard.tsx` component in `src/client/src/components/` using shadcn/ui components.

## Component API
```tsx
interface StoryCardProps {
  story: StoryDetail & { epicName?: string };
  isSessionRunning: boolean;
}
```

## Collapsed State
- Card container using shadcn `Card` component
- Left: chevron icon (ChevronRight when collapsed, ChevronDown when expanded)
- Story title (truncated if too long)
- Epic name as shadcn `Badge` (only if `epicName` exists)
- Compact meta line: shadcn `Progress` bar + "X/Y tasks" text
- When `isSessionRunning`: pulsing green dot next to title wrapped in shadcn `Tooltip` (showing session info on hover) + glowing card border via CSS animation

## Expanded State
- Uses shadcn `Collapsible` for smooth animation
- Full markdown description (reuse existing markdown rendering from the project)
- Task list with status icons:
  - Completed: `✓` with success color
  - In progress: `●` with warning color
  - Pending: `○` with muted color
  - Show `(blocked by <id>)` for tasks with blockedBy
- Progress bar (full width) with "X/Y tasks done" label
- Session running indicator (green dot + text)
- "Open story →" link (React Router `Link` to `/story/:storyId`)

## Styling
- Use existing theme CSS variables
- Add CSS `@keyframes pulse` animation for the running dot
- Add CSS `@keyframes glow` animation for the card border
- These can be in a scoped CSS module or inline Tailwind utilities

## Notes
Use the shadcn MCP server to check Card, Badge, Collapsible, and Progress component APIs and get usage examples.
guidance: Use shadcn MCP to view Card, Badge, Collapsible, Progress, and Tooltip components. Install Tooltip via `pnpm dlx shadcn@latest add tooltip` from `packages/dashboard/src/client`. Check how EpicDetail.tsx renders markdown for the description. Use Tailwind animate utilities or custom keyframes for the pulse/glow animations.
doneWhen: StoryCard component renders correctly in both collapsed and expanded states. Uses shadcn components and existing theme.
